faq.what_is_answer: Cortar Carrossel is a free online tool that allows you to split images into multiple parts to create carousel posts for Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, and other social media platforms.
faq.how_to_use_answer: It's simple! Just upload your image, choose the number of rows and columns to divide it, and download the cut images ready to post. No registration needed.
faq.is_free_answer: Yes, Cortar Carrossel is 100% free to use. There are no hidden costs, watermarks, or registration requirements.
faq.which_platforms: Which platforms does Cortar Carrossel support?
faq.which_platforms_answer: Cortar Carrossel works for all major social media platforms, including Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Pinterest, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
faq.best_dimensions: What are the best dimensions for Instagram carousel posts?
faq.best_dimensions_answer: For Instagram, the recommended size for carousel posts is 1080 x 1080 pixels (square), 1080 x 1350 pixels (portrait), or 1080 x 608 pixels (landscape). Cortar Carrossel works with any image dimensions.
faq.puzzle_post: How to create a puzzle post for Instagram?
faq.puzzle_post_answer: To create a puzzle post for Instagram, upload your image to Cortar Carrossel, split it into multiple parts (e.g., 3x3 for 9 images), download the cut images, and post them in reverse order on Instagram (from last to first). This will create a puzzle effect on your profile.
faq.marketing: Can I use Cortar Carrossel for digital marketing?
faq.marketing_answer: Yes! Cortar Carrossel is perfect for digital marketing. You can create product showcases, step-by-step tutorials, before/after comparisons, and much more. Carousel posts typically have higher engagement and can significantly increase the time users spend viewing your content.
faq.safe_images: Is Cortar Carrossel safe for my images?
faq.safe_images_answer: Absolutely! Cortar Carrossel works entirely in your device's browser. Your images are never uploaded to our servers, stored, or shared with third parties. All processing happens locally on your device, ensuring complete privacy and security for your content.
faq.file_formats: Which file formats does Cortar Carrossel support?
faq.file_formats_answer: Cortar Carrossel supports all common image formats, including JPG, PNG, GIF, and WebP. You can use virtually any image from your device.
faq.size_limit: Does Cortar Carrossel have a size limit for images?
faq.size_limit_answer: The size limit depends mainly on your browser and device capability. We recommend images up to 20MB for best performance. Very large images may process more slowly depending on your device.
faq.registration: Do I need to register to use Cortar Carrossel?
faq.registration_answer: No, you don't need to register or create an account to use Cortar Carrossel. The tool is completely free and instantly accessible without login or signup.
faq.watermarks: Does Cortar Carrossel add watermarks to images?
faq.watermarks_answer: No! Cortar Carrossel doesn't add watermarks or any other kind of identification to your images. What you see is exactly what you get.
faq.mobile_use: Can I use Cortar Carrossel on mobile devices?
faq.mobile_use_answer: Yes! Cortar Carrossel is fully responsive and works on smartphones and tablets. The interface adapts to provide a good experience on screens of all sizes.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How do I split an image online for free?
faq.a1: Simply upload your image, choose your preferred grid size (like 2x2 or 3x3), and click "Split Image". You can then download all the individual pieces for free.
faq.q2: What's the best size to split images for Instagram?
faq.a2: For Instagram carousels, split images into 2x2 or 3x3 grids. For puzzle feeds, 3x3 (9 pieces) works best. Each piece should be 1080x1080 pixels for optimal quality.
faq.q3: Can I split images without losing quality?
faq.a3: Yes! Our image splitter maintains the original quality and resolution of your image. Each split piece preserves the exact pixel data from the original.
faq.q4: Is there a limit to image size I can split?
faq.a4: You can split images up to 20MB. For best performance, we recommend images under 10MB. Larger images may take longer to process depending on your device.
